meanings.definition: Graymails: plural noun, unwanted or unsolicited emails that are not considered spam but are still bothersome
meanings.sent1: I received so many graymails today that my inbox was overflowing.
meanings.sent2: My colleague gets a lot of graymails from companies trying to sell products.
meanings.sent3: The graymails kept coming, like a never-ending stream of digital clutter.
meanings.sent4: Her inbox was a battlefield, with graymails invading from all sides.
meanings.sent5: The graymails were like pesky mosquitoes, buzzing around and annoying her constantly.

meanings.definition: Graymails: verb, to send or receive unwanted or unsolicited emails that are not considered spam but are still bothersome
meanings.sent1: I try to avoid graymailing my friends with unnecessary forwards.
meanings.sent2: She often graymails her coworkers with chain emails about office gossip.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly threatened to graymail his brother with embarrassing childhood photos.
meanings.sent4: The marketing team decided to graymail customers with daily promotional emails.
meanings.sent5: The company's automated system would graymail users with reminders to complete their profiles.
